document_data.name: House of Dubb
document_data.mainbody: The '''House of Dubb''', also called the '''House of the Bear''', was a large desert tribe of [[Zakharan pantheon|enlightened]] [[Al-Badia]] found in the southwest region of the [[High Desert]] of [[west Zakhara]] around [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p38">
document_data.Base of Operations: This tribe inhabited the southwest region of the desert bordering [[Al-Suqut Mountains]] within the [[Pearl Cities]].<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p38"/>
document_data.Organization: The House of Dubb numbered 3,000 tribesmen at the height of their power and were divided into nine separate clans.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p38"/>
document_data.Activities: Many members of the House of Dubb were herdsmen, but some of the clans harvested aromatic gums within the [[Realm of Bleeding Trees]]. The gums were traded with the city of [[Ajayib]], with whom the tribe developed an excellent relationship.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p38"/>
document_data.Relationships: The House of Dubb aided Ajayib in the caliph's raids against the mountain people of Al-Suqut.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p38"/>
document_data.Members: Sheikh [[Yaqub al-Quwwat]] led the House of Dubb in 1367 DR.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p38"/>
